revised_title: Evolution of Prokaryotic Developmental Systems: Sigma Factors and Gene Duplication
tldr: The author discusses the evolution of a prokaryotic developmental system, focusing on the role of sigma factors and gene duplication. By analyzing the relationships between sigma factors and their functions in gene expression during spore formation in Bacillus subtilis, the author proposes a possible evolutionary pathway that involves gene duplication and divergence, leading to the increasing complexity of cell-specific genetic programs.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Bacterial Development
